title: If {12/100} – 100 Days of Golang –
text:
Sama seperti di bahasa pemrograman umumnya di Golang juga kita bisa menggunakan if, else if dan else. yang sedikit berbeda adalah sintaksnya, dimana di Golang kita tidak perlu menggunakan tanda kurung ().

Variable temporary adalah variable yang kita deklarasikan setelah keyword if, variable ini hanya bisa digunakan pada blok yang bersangkutan. Mari kita perhatikan contoh diatas, kita mendeklarasikan variable finalResult setelah keyword if, dimana variable finalResult ini memiliki nilai dari variable result yang dikalkulasikan dengan dibagi 100. Variable finalResult hanya bisa digunakan di blok if, else if, dan else tersebut, diluar itu variable finalResult tidak akan bisa digunakan.

title: Golang 101 {1/100} – 100 Days of Golang –
text:
Golang dibuat pada tahun 2007 di Google oleh 3 orang yaitu Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson. Mereka bertiga memberikan statement bahwa mereka semua membenci C++. Thompson adalah salah satu penguji awal C++, dia melakukan testing dengan membuat beberapa program C++, tapi setelah itu dia menolak untuk menggunakan C++ karena seringnya terjadi tidak kompatibel antara versi.

Saya akan berusaha untuk membuat setiap tulisan saya simpel dan to the point, walaupun akan sedikit dibumbui intermezzo disetiap tulisannya. Why? because people love story.

Sebelum melakukan instalasi, please make sure that your os or architectures sensuai dengan yg ada diatas. Pertanyaannya adalah, kalau tidak ada yg sesuai bagaimana? tenang, kita mungkin masih bisa menginstal dari source atau menggunakan gccgo. Kita disini tidak akan belajar tentang cara penginstalan via source atau gccgo karna saya akan membuat tulisan ini sesimpel mungkin.

Kalau kita melihat pesan “Hello, Pram” then our Go installation is workin perfectly.

title: 100 days of golang – 100 Days of Golang –
text:
I just decided to challenge myself to learn about Golang in 100 days. I know the best method to learn something is to write it down. In fact, it seems that writing anything down makes us remember it better. You can read this one Writing and Remembering: Why We Remember What We Write.

I’m getting inspired by Jean Hsu’s 100 days of memories. I often thinking what if I can make #the100dayproject like she and others do, but I don’t know what kind of project I should make.

Golang or Go is open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software. Created at Google in 2007 by Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson. The language was announced in November 2009, it is used in some of Google’s production system, as well as by other firms.

Golang seems to be promising to learn, so what if I make my own 100 Day Project about Golang? Why not.

Just like Jean Hsu, I’m going to put this line.

“ Don’t judge me too much if I don’t keep up or drop out.”.

title: Happy Software Engineer – Pramesti Hatta K. –
text:
They told me work and life should be balance, I told them itsn’t about work vs life, It’s about doing something I love in life. Itsn’t work vs life, it’s all about hobby vs life.

I love to build something, I love typing code, I love deleting code, I love copying and pasting code, I love searching answer on Stackoverflow, I love something that makes me think.

Sometimes my hobby makes me overwhelmed.

Sometimes my hobby makes me f*cked up.

But more often,

It makes me happy.

When I was a kid, I wasn’t lucky like any other kids out there who have personal computer from their parents. I had to go to Cyber Cafe and pay Rp. 3000/hour for rent a computer and internet. I started playing computer since I was 6th grade of elementary school. Going back to that time, all I did on computer is playing a game named Tantra, I got crazy of this game.

After Tantra, I play Rising Force(RF), Ayo Dance, Counter Strike, Point Blank and other games. In Junior High School, my parents give me Rp. 5000/day and I spend my Rp. 4000 for Cyber cafe and Rp. 1000 for a drink, shit I’m so stupid at this time. After I realize that I just spend too much money, I stop playing online games, I stop when I was at my 2nd grade of Junior High School.

My first phone was Nokia E63 and I think I’m lucky to have this phone as my first phone, because this phone is Symbian based and there are many communities out there who love to hacking this OS. I joined a grup in Facebook (Nokia E63 Community) and there are many people talk about hacking this OS in that group — if you hack the OS, you have a full responsibility on your phone, you can change everything, you can make your Nokia phone looks like Blackberry (of course without BBM) or Android. even, I can play Harvest Moon in my phone :).

I installed an application named Light Notepad on my phone and started to learn HTML and CSS at High School. Yes I started coding from phone, not computer.

I entered college and still doesn’t have personal computer/laptop, my first laptop is TOSHIBA with 2.2 GHz intel dual core processor and 2 gb of ram and I got it when I was at my 2nd semester. I learn C++ in my early days of college. I got lucky I had smart lecturer, her name is Indah Dwijayanti (I would be happy if she reads this story), she was my lecturer of my Algorithm & Programming class. Maybe if I got another lecturer, I wouldn’t understand how to write C++ code. That was the first time I learn about programming (yes I started coding from High School, but it only HTML and CSS and they both are not programming languages, they are just Mark-up languages) and I enjoyed it.

It was love at first sight.

So if you ask me how I can spend my time everyday sit there in front of my laptop, a simple answer is, I am happy with what I do.

title: Getting Started With Arduino Uno + JavaScript (JavaScript Robotics is on the rise)
text:
Once upon a time, it’s a huge pain in the ass to play with hardware stuffs, we have to write our program with Assembly/C/whatever the fuck it is to get shit done. But now, since there’s Node.js and the guy named Rick Waldron created amazing library of JavaScript components that know how to talk to an Arduino through the “Firmata” protocol(a standard protocol for computers to communicate with hardware devices), it becomes easier to play with hardware stuffs.

You know, JavaScript is getting bigger and bigger. I remember when the first time I learn about Web Development, I was only learn JavaScript to change the background color of the page, and now, JavaScript is everywhere.. from frontend to backend, from software to hardware. Sometimes I’m thinking a lot, a lot like “What the fuck is going on man… :)”.

By the way the library we talked above is Johnny-Five. The JavaScript Library that know how to talk to Arduino, raspberry pi & etc.

Okay let the hacking begin.

title: What the Heck is Single Page Application – Pramesti Hatta K. –
text:
Have you heard about single page application? did you know how single page application work? maybe if you haven’t heard about that and didn’t know how that thing work, you just talk to yourself like “what the fuck is that man”.

This is some clear explanation about what is SPA (we will use spa as abbreviation of single page application in this post) from https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/dn463786.aspx

These are two pictures that visualize the difference between Traditional Page Lifecycle and SPA Lifecycle

If we take a look at what Traditional Page does, everytime our application (client side) does some request to server, our application (client side) will reload the HTML. let’s take a look at what SPA does, it will only render HTML once. after that, everytime our application (client side) does some request to server, the HTML won’t be reload. Instead, it will do asynchronous request (AJAX) and will receive JSON.

Did you already got the point bro?

If you didn’t, let’s do some practical explanation.

Write an HTML file like this (you can just copy-paste this html and run on your computer):

If we run this HTML, and click the Go to bookmark link, it will going like this

Everytime we click the Go to bookmark link, look at our URL, it makes hash #/bookmark, and it will jump us to the HTML section with ID /bookmark. If you know HTML so well, you won’t be suprised.

There’s something interisting we can do with this in JavaScript, let’s edit our HTML

And let’s make JavaScript file named app.js, and start listening for an event, remember the event loop in JavaScript, right?

So this code means, if there’s some ‘hashchange’ event, do something, in this code, we will make log with the value of our curent hash (window.location.hash). Let’s run our HTML + JS

And there’s something more interisting we can do, let’s edit our JS

So, this time we do flow control programming (if condition), what we do are, we do check if current hash is #/bookmark, we will make a log, this is just a log, in real application we can do some asynchronous request or something.

Let’s make some fun, edit our HTML and JS

Everytime we click the link, whether go to bookmark or go to about or etc, our JavaScript will be execute, because we add hashchange event listener, and our JavaScript will do flow control programming, check, if current hash is equal to something, then do something (in this case we make a log).

Look at our URL, everytime we change our hash, our index.html doesn’t change, and that’s single page application, we just load our HTML once, after that our application (client side) can make asynchronous request (AJAX) to server and will receive response JSON.

If there’s something wrong about my explanation, just let me know.

This post was inspired by https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvHecQOiu8g

This is an example how we make SPA with Angular.js https://github.com/opam22/angular_best_practice

title: If Sherlock Holmes did Software Developer – Pramesti Hatta K. –
text:
Sherlock Holmes is a fictional private detective created by British author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Known as a “consulting detective” in the stories, Holmes is known for a proficiency with observation, forensic science, and logical reasoning that borders on the fantastic.

I started read Sherlock Holmes since 2013, but until now I still don’t read until the end of the story LOL. I really love BBC version of Sherlock Holmes, it’s fantastic, it’s a modern version of Sherlock Holmes and I’m just falling in love since the first time I saw this TV Series.

If you are a big fan of Sherlock Holmes or a big fan of Benedict Cumberbatch(Many people love Sherlock because they like Benedict) so you definitely know about the way he thinks, how he thinks and of course, how asshole he is :)

Let’s take a minute…

Let’s imagine…

What if…

What if this madafaka did Software Developer?

This post was inspired by Dan Pupius’ If Dr House did DevOps.

Thank you for reading.

title: Me and Linux: Still a better love story than twillight saga.
text:
Me and Linux: Still a better love story than twillight saga.

I’ve been using it since I got my first computer.

I’ve been fallin in love with this kernel since the first time I try to make my computer running on dual boot system (Windows and Ubuntu 14.04).

At the first time, I got Windows on my computer, but then I heard there was some amazing operating system out there, I try to find out, and then I found Linux. “What the heck is Linux” the first thing that comes out on my mind when I found it, I try to ask other, some people told me that is an operating system, some people told me that is a kernel, and then, I finnaly figured out, Linux is a Kernel and there are many operating systems (distro) out there using Linux as its Kernel.

Linux was created by Linus Torvalds, a man that I admire so much. He creates linux just because he wants to make Unix-like operating system, but he wants to make it free and open source so that everyone can use his Unix-like operating system.

I choose Ubuntu as my first linux-based operating system, I try to run my compoter on dual boot mode, so I can switch from Windows to Ubuntu or Ubuntu to Windows whenever I want. At the first time I still use Windows more than Ubuntu, Because at the time I feel comfortable write C++ code on Windows (using Borland C++). I don’t know how to run C++ on Ubuntu because I’m new on this operating system. I was on my first semester at that time.

Time flies so fast, and finnaly at this time, I’m using Ubuntu as my 100% operating system, there’s no Microsoft stuff on my computer, It doesn’t mean that I hate Microsoft technology, I still respect them, They really made greate technology for Personal Computer, but, you know I’m a Web Application Developer , and I think that Linux-based operating system is the best operating system for my daily activity.

My lecture ever said something funny at class like this “It’s hard to find person who use full Linux-based operating system as their primary operating system, is there someone who use Linux-based as primary operating system here?” and I’m just speak like “Sh*t, I’m that person sir haha” in my heart.

In the end of this story I just want to thank to all person that contribute to make the world better, weither you make an open source project or not, you are awesome.

The boy that admire you,

title: Mercury – Pramesti Hatta K. –
text:
You are Mercury,

that move so fast with its 170.503 km/h,

to surround Orbit Velocity.

And I’m Sun, 

that doesn’t move,

With its yellow and 6,0877×1012 km2 body.

When you move fast, 

my heart is breathing faster.

We are so close.

You are the closer planet to me that exist in this fucking orbit.

I am sorry

that you will never know

how much I love you.

You think you get it.

You only see Universe with its unlimited space,

but you don’t see Sun with its Warm body

that always try to warm you up on every single day.

You see the shadow of universe,

and think, “Sun is flat”

But it is a huge thing

and not flat.

title: 3 Things I Learned in 2015 – Pramesti Hatta K. –
text:
2015 was a great year, I have stresses, financial problem, and mental breakdown.

But in the end of the year I realize I learned many things in that year, 2015 was the best year I’ve ever had since I was born. On January — February — March, I felt like shit, I was fucked up lv. 100.

I have a financial problem, I have to stop my study in college for 1 semester because I have no money to pay my college administration. In the end of 2014, I’ve break up with my girlfriend, I’ve been dissapointed by the one that I think will not dissapoint me. My parents have a a big fight around February. Even my laptop (the tool I used to learn programming) was broken, its LCD was broken and I have no money too fix it.

As you read above, in the begining of 2015, My head and my heart was broken at the same time. In that moment there’s only one thing on my head ‘Oh shit, this is the zero point of my life, I have to do something to fix all of this, I believe I can fix this’.

On 1st of April, I start to work as a Junior Web Developer in company named PT. Misete Solusi Teknologi, I’ve one project in that company. Since I have work, My financial situation was improved, I already no longer depend on my parents for money. My life was getting better and better, I met new people and new friends.

I worked for Misete for just 3 months and then I move into Start-up company named PT. Tulpar Asia Digital, we have 2 projects, the first one is http://e-tender.asia and the second one is http://kece.id by the way I still working in Tulpar until now.

Today, on 1st of January 2016. I realize 2015 was an amazing year, I learn a lot of things, here’s a few things I learned in 2015:

Yup, the dark moments can turn you into shiny diamond.

Yup, whatever that happen in your life right now, just LET IT BE, everything’s gonna be okay, no matter what.

I don’t know how much I play The Beatles’ Let It Be song in 2015 :)

Yup, nothing lasts forever, even the pain that caused by ‘nothing lasts forever’ is also do not last forever.

I know, I’m still 20, and in the near future I will have much dark moments like I have in 2015.

But, I believe no matter what the fuck things that will happen in my life, I’m still damn FINE.

title: Simple Login, Logout, Register, and EMAIL VERIFICATION with Laravel 5.1
text:
Pertanyaan selanjutnya, how to make things like that?

Okay the answer is over here, below here…

Pertama-tama disini saya akan membeberkan apa saja yang kita butuhkan, oh iya disini kita tidak akan memakai AuthController bawaan dari laravel. Instead, we will make our own controller to handle authentication :)

Some things we need

See? The activation_code and active column I add above?

Kolom itu nanti yang akan kita gunakan untuk

activation_code = digunakan untuk menyimpan & mencocokan kode aktivasi

active = apabila user telah melakukan aktivasi, maka kita akan mengupdate kolom ini.

Disana juga saya menggunakan form builder laravel. So it’s up to you, If u want to use form builder, or u can use form as usual.. your code, your choice :p

This is the main part right? haaaaaaa :)

Okay kita sudah buat form untuk registrasi nya dan kalau kita perhatikan kita juga sudah mengarahkan actionnya dengan method route ke route yang bernama post-registration, tapi kita belum membuat route ini, so let’s do that baby

Kita sudah berhasil membuat aplikasi kita bisa dipakai untuk registrasi, dan lalu mengaktivasi nya lewat email, so mari kita selesaikan ini dengan menambahkan yang terakhir, yaitu, Log in and Log out.

Masih banyak sebetulnya yang perlu dilakukan, mulai dari memunculkan message hingga me redirect ke view ketika berhasil log in, aktifasi, error ketika mencoba log in padahal akun belum terverifikasi dsb, di tutorial ini saya cuman menampilkan return saja ketika hal itu dilakukan, tidak me redirectnya ke view, hal itu bisa kalian lakukan sendiri hehe, nanti malah kepanjangan tutorialnya…

Kalian juga perlu memanfaatkan middleware…

Karna sejujurnya tutorial ini dibuat lebih fokus ke Email Verification-nya.
